full_text: Pasar peat es 2017/KER/947 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT: THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE SUNIL THOMAS MONDAY, THE 9TH DAY OF JANUARY 2017/19TH POUSHA, 1938 Crl.MC.No. 153 of 2017 () AGAINST THE ORDER/JUDGMENT IN CC 1787/2014 of J.M.F.C.,VATAKARA CRIME NO. 1022/2014 OF VATAKARA POLICE STATION , KOZHIKODE PETITIONER(S): ABDUL LATHEEF S/O.MUHAMMED, AGED 31 YEARS MADAKUMMOOLAYIL HOUSE, VELOM, PERUVAYAL, VATAKARA TALUK, KOZHIKODE. BY ADVS.SRI.JINU JOSEPH SRILN.SHANOJ SRIL.C.MOHAMMED HABEEB SRI.LP.K.MOHAMED JAMEEL RESPONDENT(S): 1. STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY SECRETARY DEPARTMENT OF HOME, SECRETARIAT, THIRUVANANTHAPURAM - 695001 2. THE SUB INSPECTOR OF POLICE VATAKARA POLICE STATION, VATAKARA, KOZHIKODE - 693001. R1-2 BY PUBLIC PROSECUTOR SRI.C.S.HRITHWIK THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 09-01-2017, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: ieee 2017/KER/947 Cri.MC.No. 153 of 2017 APPENDIX PETITIONER(S)' EXHIBITS ANNEXURE AI TRUE COPY OF THE FIR NO.1022/14 DATED 16/10/2014 ANNEXURE A2 THE TRUE COPY OF THE POST MORTEM REPORT DATED 17/10/2014 ANNEXURE A3_ TRUE COPY OF THE INQUEST REPORT DATED 16/10/2014 ANNEXURE A4 TRUE COPY OF THE STATEMENT OF WITNESSES ANNEXURE A5 TRUE COPY OF THE REPORT OF INSPECTION OF VEHICLE INVOLVED IN ACCIDENT ANNEXURE A6 TRUE COPY OF THE SCENE MAHAZAR ANNEXURE A7_ CERTIFIED COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN C.C NO.1787/2014 RESPONDENT(S)' EXHIBITS NIL H TRUE COPY // P.A TO JUDGE rmm Been ae 2017/KER/947 SUNIL THOMAS, J. Dated this the 9" day of January, 2017 ORDER The petitioner herein is the sole accused in C.C.No.1787/2014 of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court, Vatakara for offences punishable under Sections 279 and 304 A of the Indian penal Code. The prosecution alleged that, the accused herein, drove his vehicle in a rash and negligent manner on 15.10.2014 at 10.a.m., in such a manner as to endanger the life of the people, hit against a person, who was thrown off, had allegedly sustained injuries and later succumbed. After investigation, final report was laid. 2. Contending that his vehicle had not sustained any damage, that his vehicle had not hit the victim and that he has been falsely implicated, the petitioner has sought to quash the entire proceedings. 3. Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and the learned Public Prosecutor. 3. The prosecution is essentially relying on the Petetae ops 2017/KER/947 Crl.M.C.No. 153 of 2017 2 postmortem report which indicates that the victim died due to the injury sustained to his head. Eye witnesses have been arrayed to substantiate the allegation that, they have seen the incident and that the vehicle was driven by the petitioner herein in a rash and negligent manner. Hence, it is clear that the question whether he was driving the vehicle, whether it was rashly and negligently driven and that he had caused the death of the person are all matters which are in the realms of appreciation of evidence. I do not feel that this is a matter which can be challenged in a proceeding under Section 482 of the Code of Criminal Procedure. The Crl.M.C. fails and is dismissed accordingly. Sd/- SUNIL THOMAS , JUDGE. rmm/11/1/2017 // True Copy // P.A. To Judge rmm
